options.text: to allow more aircraft to safely and efficiently utilise a given volume of airspace.
to provide a more efficient, safe, and cost-effective system for communication.
in order to automate and distribute departure slots.
to effectively monitor aircraft systems` status information and fuel consumption.

variant.question: You are in the cruise, and approaching an FIR in which CPDLC is available, but not compulsory. What factors influence whether to use the datalink or rely on voice communications?

options.text: Pilot errors and workload are reduced, and ATC workload is reduced, by using datalink communications.
Voice communications are more reliable and easier for the controller.
In remote areas, with datalink there is a greater risk of being out of range of the current controller without being handed over to the next controller.
Short cuts and direct routings are easier for both pilots and cotrollers using voice communications.
